trans-unit.source: A common theme in content management, is publishing a web document, and then needing to revise it but not to change the published web content, till the modified document has undergone a review cycle.
trans-unit.target: A common theme in content management, is publishing a web document, and then needing to revise it but not to change the published web content, till the modified document has undergone a review cycle.

trans-unit.source: Workgroup or person working on a document, the ability to checkout and lock a document allows for a editing cycle, without concern of overwrites, and with an audit trail of versions.
trans-unit.target: Workgroup or person working on a document, the ability to checkout and lock a document allows for a editing cycle, without concern of overwrites, and with an audit trail of versions.

trans-unit.source: _doAddUser
trans-unit.target: _doAddUser

trans-unit.source: a confirmation dialog is displayed, if the checkout is canceled the working copy is destroyed, and the baseline is unlocked.
trans-unit.target: a confirmation dialog is displayed, if the checkout is canceled the working copy is destroyed, and the baseline is unlocked.

trans-unit.source: a user is asked for a checkin message. on checkin the working copy is merged into the baseline, and a new version of the baseline is created, and the baseline is unlocked.
trans-unit.target: a user is asked for a checkin message. on checkin the working copy is merged into the baseline, and a new version of the baseline is created, and the baseline is unlocked.

trans-unit.source: checkouts have some system additional properties, versioning and workflow. they can be versioned independently of the baseline, with only changes from the latest version being merged into the baseline on checkin. they can undergoe separate workflows different from the baseline content. (this last feature requires some customization see docs/workflow.rst ).
trans-unit.target: checkouts have some system additional properties, versioning and workflow. they can be versioned independently of the baseline, with only changes from the latest version being merged into the baseline on checkin. they can undergoe separate workflows different from the baseline content. (this last feature requires some customization see docs/workflow.rst ).

trans-unit.target: in general upgrade step. [maurits]

trans-unit.source: includeDependencies
trans-unit.target: includeDependencies

trans-unit.source: iterate integrates with the plone user interface mainly through the actions menu. it adds three conditional actions to the menu.. checkout, checkin, and cancel checkout.
trans-unit.target: iterate integrates with the plone user interface mainly through the actions menu. it adds three conditional actions to the menu.. checkout, checkin, and cancel checkout.

trans-unit.source: iterate is a Plone add-on that allows one to utilize a checkin / checkout procedure for content editing. It integrates in versioning, locking, and utilizes Zope technology like adapters and events to allow for easy customization.
trans-unit.target: iterate is a Plone add-on that allows one to utilize a checkin / checkout procedure for content editing. It integrates in versioning, locking, and utilizes Zope technology like adapters and events to allow for easy customization.

trans-unit.source: iterate was designed to solve/enable the following use cases.
trans-unit.target: iterate was designed to solve/enable the following use cases.

trans-unit.source: locking using zope dav locks
trans-unit.target: locking using zope dav locks

trans-unit.source: no special case that enables checkout via GET [gotcha]
trans-unit.target: no special case that enables checkout via GET [gotcha]

trans-unit.source: observable behavior via events
trans-unit.target: observable behavior via events

trans-unit.source: on this form a user is asked to which location they wish to checkout the current content, the vocabulary of checkouts is overridable via template customization and is currently the current folder, and the user’s home folder. if the content is not yet versioned, versioning is applied and a new version is created before the checkout is performed. an adapter is utilized to perform the checkout mechanics and an object lifecycle event is generated with the baseline ( origin ) and checkout as attributes. the adapter is responsible for effecting a copy of the content to the checkout location and taking a lock on the origin content. whether this form and action are active on a given piece of content depends on the iterate policy adapter found for this content.
trans-unit.target: on this form a user is asked to which location they wish to checkout the current content, the vocabulary of checkouts is overridable via template customization and is currently the current folder, and the user’s home folder. if the content is not yet versioned, versioning is applied and a new version is created before the checkout is performed. an adapter is utilized to perform the checkout mechanics and an object lifecycle event is generated with the baseline ( origin ) and checkout as attributes. the adapter is responsible for effecting a copy of the content to the checkout location and taking a lock on the origin content. whether this form and action are active on a given piece of content depends on the iterate policy adapter found for this content.

trans-unit.source: plone.app.iterate depends on GenericSetup >= 1.8.2 for using a post_handler on registerProfile [iham]
trans-unit.target: plone.app.iterate depends on GenericSetup >= 1.8.2 for using a post_handler on registerProfile [iham]

trans-unit.target: pluggable behavior for policies via adapters

trans-unit.target: removed “change portal events” permission [kakshay21]

trans-unit.target: setted lock timeout to MAX_TIMEOUT to avoid baseline unwanted unlock after 10 minutes [parruc]

trans-unit.target: simple, clean integration with the plone user interface

trans-unit.source: visually checkouts are distinguished by an extra document icon (next to sendto, and rss links). clicking on this icon will lead to a checkout status page. which allows for looking at information regarding the checkout itself, such as when the checkout was performed and by whom.
